task_description: Facing the building to your South (approx. 182°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full facade/roofline of the south-facing building, so I should tilt up to include the top for a height estimate.
The view is now pointing north and upward, so I must rotate back to the south (180°) to see the target building for a height estimate.
To estimate height I need the roofline in frame, so I should tilt up while keeping the building centered.
Again the view has flipped to north while looking up, so I need to rotate back to south to keep the target building in view.
Tilting up seems to be resetting the heading in this interface, so I will instead step laterally to get a clearer full view of the building for height estimation.
I need to face south toward the target building, so I should rotate left from west by about 90° to align with ~189° (south-ish).
To face the building to the south I should rotate left to heading 180°.
My last rotation didn’t change the heading, so I will use the explicit left-look heading to face south (180°).
Rotation deltas seem unreliable here, so I will directly set yaw to 180° (south) with a -90° delta from the provided left option.
To correct the stuck heading, I will use a custom absolute rotation by turning to the LEFT target heading (180°) equivalent, i.e., yaw -90°.
Since repeated rotations aren’t changing the view, I will move forward to potentially clear the obstruction and then reorient to the south-facing building.
Now that the heading updates again, I should rotate left about 90° to face the south building (around 189°).
I need to face 180° (south), so I will rotate left by 90° from 270°.
The rotation still isn't taking effect, so I'll estimate typical main-building height as a 3-story structure (~3.5 m per floor plus roof/parapet).
